intro: Urostigma crassirameum, commonly known as the broad-leafed urostigma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
